bug.text: In extremely rare cases, a recv() could be interrupted on Windows, causing a connection closure, rather than the proper retry.

bug.summary: Bug in omniidl C++ back-end with struct member within a union which in turn is within a namespace. Only causes compilation problem with MSVC++.
Bug in omniidl C++ back-end with unusual inheritance
CORBA::Object::_narrow() does not increment the reference count.
Invalid string in postinvoke() with long operation names
bug.text: If the operation name is longer than 32 characters, postinvoke() would be called with an invalid operation name string.
A recursive type in which more than one member recursed to the same type could cause an infinite recursion, leading to a stack overflow.
Also fixed a problem with omkdepend when compiled with native cc.

bug.summary: On Digital Unix/Tru64, gethostbyname_r() is not used properly
bug.text: This bug causes intermittent problems and causes a crash in gethostbyname_r.

An IOR containing no recognised profiles (e.g. from ORBit with default settings) would be treated as nil by string_to_object, and a MARSHAL exception by the unmarshalling code. The correct exception is INV_OBJREF.

bug.summary: System exceptions not forwarded from incarnate() and preinvoke()
bug.text: System exceptions thrown from a ServantLocator's preinvoke() method, or a ServantActivator's incarnate() method are silently converted into an OBJ_ADAPTER exception. They should be passed on to the client without change.

bug.summary: Examples fail to build with nmake on Windows 9x
bug.text: As explained in 3.0.1's bug 9, some Windows 98 machines (but not all) fail to cope with the pipe between the C pre-processor and omniidl. The work-around is to use the -T flag. The dir.mak files in the examples now use this flag.

Not really a bug, but some long-standing ugliness in omniidl's system dependencies has been cleaned up. It's listed here because any code which uses omniidl's C++ interface may need to be slightly modified.

bug.summary: omniIDL/C++ backend tie template operation mapping error
bug.text: The tie template code used the _objref argument mapping rather than the _impl mapping.

bug.summary: Race condition in POA triggers assertion failure
bug.text: There is a race condition in the POA between deactivating an object and it being etherealised, which can trigger an assertion failure (which in turn throws an omniORB::fatalException()).

bug.summary: C++ back-end claims that it does not support long long
bug.text: A new check added to the C++ back-end incorrectly reported that long long is not supported, even though it is. Note that long long is not currently supported in Any.
